full_text: Will be on @drivetimerte shortly to outline the need for a legally robust plan to improve air quality in areas currently not covered by the #smokycoalban

Legal threat by coal companies is to both strike down a new nationwide smoky coal ban and the existing ban, on the basis that the state should also have to ban the burning of other fossil fuels, including wood and peat products. Working with the attorney general on a way forward

Disappointed that a number of coal firms have indicated that they would challenge the extension of the smoky coal ban. Am working with the Attorney General to develop legally robust plan to reduce particulate matter in the air

I was delighted to welcome @CharlieFlanagan to Coolock today & it was confirmed; - 30 new Gardaí for Coolock District from June 10th - discussions between An Garda Síochana and the OPW to progression a new Garda Station to serve the communities of Darndale, Clongriffin & Belmayne https://t.co/paBR1bjHC9
The Celtic Interconnector will be vital to getting our electricity up to 70% renewable https://t.co/NWe2VZjOpH

This 700MW electricity interconnector will be vital to delivering 70% renewable electricity by 2030. It will be our only direct electricity link to the EU post Brexit. This 575km link will run from France to Ireland. https://t.co/otp3k7IMbM
I’ll be on @morningireland and @BreakfastNT shortly

The National Broadband Plan will be the biggest investment in rural Ireland since electrification - it will ensure that 1 million people who do not have access to high speed broadband will have the same opportunities as those who live in our towns and cities

Will be on @RTENewsAtOne shortly ahead of my appearance at the Committee later today. We are building a high speed broadband network for the 1.1million people in rural Ireland where commercial operators will not invest. Without this Plan, these people will be left behind

I spoke about the critical challenge of climate disruption & how we have failed to break the link btw economic growth and carbon. Both have the extraordinary depth of knowledge & experience to represent Dublin excellently at this critical juncture @FineGael https://t.co/QmK6ArKYNp
@somerville73 Hi Aidan, speeds will start at 150mbs and rise to 500mbs In year 10. A 1gb option would also be developed

On @morningireland and @BreakfastNT shortly on the National Broadband Plan and the transformational impact it will have on rural ireland
On @RTE_PrimeTime shortly to discuss the rollout of the National Broadband Plan to 540,000 premises and 1.1 million people across rural Ireland
I have also asked the Chair of the Oireachtas Communications committee @1Hildegarde for an early slot to appear before the committee to discuss the National Broadband Plan
I have asked the chief whip to request the business committee to make time available this week to discuss the National Broadband Plan
It will ensure that every home, farm and business – no matter how rural or remote - has access to high speed broadband.
This is about equal access to services and opportunities for everyone, no matter where they live or work.
The National Broadband Plan is the largest investment in rural Ireland since rural electrification. It is just as important to the future as electricity was then.
Today is a transformational day for rural Ireland

Mobile coverage of 30mbps to 99.5% of the country would require an additional 6,000 new masts around the country (double what we have now), would take over 10 years, would have insufficient capacity and signal would be significantly affected by home insulation, hills etc

I’d like to thank the Committee, and in particular @1Hildegarde for her leadership as Chair, for this Report which reached cross party consensus on a number of difficult issues
I welcome the publication of the Report from the All Party Climate Action Committee, chaired by @1Hildegarde on the recommendations from the Citizens Assembly

Earlier this week I set out proposals to introduce a new Online Safety Act. I believe relying on operators to self-regulate is no longer an option and we must do more to protect children online https://t.co/3CHDGME1wC
Dropped into @science_blast to meet local schools to see their great projects https://t.co/8lSM9dCXW2
Thank you for your great welcome this morning. I really enjoyed meeting you and answering your questions about online safety https://t.co/aOy1oXMVzR
Today I announced that I would bring forward a new Online Safety Act which will improve online safety and help protect children online https://t.co/PIaYgNOAh1
Great song on internet safety from St Brigids GNS in Glasnevin this morning https://t.co/KC0dWmkJqN
There will be a short 6 week consultation and I urge all parents and students, all teachers, all industry and groups who have views on these issues, to take part – https://t.co/CuoUtUdKlg

The second role of the Online Safety Commissioner would be to apply European Law to video sharing. The new law requires significant changes to the way in which Ireland regulates video sharing platforms
The Commissioner will also be given powers to administer fines for non-compliance and publish whether or not a company has complied, among other very significant powers
An Online Safety Commissioner will be given a number of powers, such as certifying that the Online Safety Codes put in place by operators are fit for purpose

The Online Safety Act will place new requirements on operators, such as the requirement to operate an Online Safety Code, which would have a number of minimum requirements, such the prohibition of cyber bullying for example
This new legislation will protect our children online and will be overseen by a regulator, an Online Safety Commissioner
The era of self regulation in this area is over and a new Online Safety Act is necessary
I believe that the situation at present where online and social media companies are not subject to any oversight or regulation by the state is no longer sustainable
New technology is transforming how we work, live and learn. This provides huge opportunities for us all, but it also presents new risks which we have to respond to
Today I am announcing that I will introduce a new Online Safety Act to improve online safety and protect our children online. I will be on @MorningIreland @BreakfastNT shortly
